intro: Alibertia edulis, commonly known as araçá-do-cerrado, is a shrub native to the Brazilian Cerrado ecosystem. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, white flowers. The plant is known for its edible fruits, which are consumed both raw and cooked. Its leaves are also used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Alibertia edulis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting local biodiversity.
